description: Before everyone fishes, there are 100 tons of fish in the lake.
Kate wanted to catch 50 tons of fish, and caught 21 tons.

The group of fishermen discussed their recent catches and noticed changes in the lake's ecosystem, such as new aquatic plants growing near the surface, indicating improving water quality, and expressed hope for even more fish in the future.
conversation: Mayor

Ladies and gentlemen, let me give you the monthly fishing report. John caught 18 tons of fish. Kate caught 21 tons of fish. Jack caught 24 tons of fish. Emma caught 16 tons of fish. Luke caught 21 tons of fish.
John

Wow, great catch everyone! I'm a bit surprised by how much fish we were able to catch this month. I was hoping to catch around 40 tons, but I ended up with 18. It looks like we all did pretty well. I'm curious, did anyone notice any changes in the lake's ecosystem this month? Maybe changes in the fish's behavior or any new species showing up?
Kate

Hey John, I'm a bit surprised by how much fish we caught this month too! I was aiming for 50 tons, but only managed to catch 21. I did notice that there seemed to be more fish closer to the surface this month, maybe they're getting easier to catch? Also, I saw some new fishing gear in the store that I'm thinking of trying out next month. Anyone else notice any changes in the lake's ecosystem?
Emma

Hey guys, I'm a bit disappointed with my catch this month. I was hoping to catch more than 16 tons, but it looks like the fish were a bit more elusive than usual. I did notice that there were some changes in the lake's ecosystem this month. I saw some new aquatic plants growing near the surface, which could indicate that the water quality is improving. Maybe we'll see even more fish next month!
Luke
